listitem.para: The default hash truncation for sha2_256 is 128 bits. Linux implemented the draft version which stated 96 bits. This option enables using the bad 96 bits version to interop with older linux kernels (unpatched version 2.6.33 and older) and openswan versions before 2.6.38. Currently the accepted values are no, (the default) signifying default IETF truncation of 128 bits, or yes, signifying 96 bits broken Linux kernel style truncation.
